style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Levante Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Levante started as many home brewing dreams start; the mission to create the perfect beer in a three gallon pot in the kitchen of a small apartment. Eric and Tim quickly realized that this is an excercise in futility, but along the way, their steadfast persistence and the quest to make a truly satisfying beer has resulted in countless hours of research and experimentation. While the small 5 gallon batches allowed for plenty of great experience, they yearned for more creative control.

The brewers decided it was time for a more professional three vessel system, giving them complete control over the brewing process. The 1/2 barrel system gave the brewers a solid platform to refine and perfect a lineup of beers for the most discerning pallet. This led to the creation of several great recipes, and a roster of clean crisp beers. The original hobby transformed into a passion for sharing world-class hand crafted beers with those who would appreciate them. 

Levante Brewing currently brews on our 15 bbl production brewery system located in West Chester, PA. We are servicing several local restaurants, pubs and distributers. Levante aims to deliver a variety of creative brews to beer lovers in Philadelphia's western suburbs and beyond.

data.name: Lewmeister Oktoberfest
data.description: Amber, full-bodied lager made in the traditional style with German hops. Brewed in early August and put on tap with a keg of the previous years batch by October of each year. This beer is brewed in memory of "Lewis", the owners beer-drinking long-haired Dachsund, who passed away at 17-1/2 on 8/17/99.

breweries.name: Amherst Brewing Company
breweries.description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

data.name: Lobo Oktoberfest
data.description: This traditional style Marzen is a deep copper colored lager, brewed using only the finest German malts and hops.  With hints of caramel, biscuit, roasted nuts, and a toasty finish, this autumn lager is the perfect way to celebrate Oktoberfest, even if you aren't in Munich!

available.description: Available during the fall months.

breweries.name: Pedernales Brewing Company
breweries.description: Pedernales Brewing Company is proud to announce their highly anticipated opening in the city of Fredericksburg, Texas. Texas Hill Country's newest microbrewery will feature Classic and German-style beers. PBC’s impressive lineup of beers will include skillfully crafted lagers and ales. At this time we are offering our flagship brands; LOBO and LOBO Negro. “LOBO” is the name of the WOLF native to Texas and the Southwest.  Sadly, the wolf was almost wiped out by big ranchers some 100 years ago; not unlike the small craft brewers who were similarly annihilated by prohibition.

data.name: Mad Bishop
data.description: Mad Bishop, one of our most popular seasonal brews, has been haunting the congregation with its distinct copper color, rich toasted malt flavor and aroma, and 5.8% abv since it was first brewed in 1996. This true German-style Oktoberfest combines complex aromas and flavors of sweet and toasted malt, a smooth mouthfeel created by an 8 week lagering process, and a clean, crisp finish for a sermon that’s easy to swallow.

breweries.name: DuClaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

breweries.name: Blue Ridge Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Blue Ridge Brewing Co. is an established restaurant and brewery, offering 15 years of experience brewing only the finest of home brews and cooking an extraordinary array of unique dishes. Please, stop on by!

Born in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Greenville's Brew-Pub continues to pay homage to one simple creed, to provide our customers the very best we can! We're as proud of Chef Rich's House-Made Menu as we are of Jay's Freshly Crafted Brews!

data.name: Maerzen
data.description: Often called "Oktoberfestbier", this amber lager is actually the classic style from Vienna, Austria.  It has a bright copper color and a big body, but no obtrusive hop aroma as is often found in amber beers elsewhere.  Enjoyed so much by the people of Bavaria that it eventually replaced the Dunkel as the beer of choice at Munich's famed Oktoberfest.

data.name: Magic Mile Marzen
data.description: Our March lager is a blend of Pilsner and Vienna malt with American-grown noble hop varieties and a Bavarian yeast. It finishes dry, like a Vienna lager, but this stronger style has more toasted malt flavor.

breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

Iowa's most award winning, oldest and largest microbrewery, located in the historic Amana Colonies.

To craft quality beer in the Midwest! Award-winning beers and sodas.

data.name: Manayunk Lager
data.description:
In strict accordance with the German purity law of 1516, we present to you this annually brewed festbier. Traditionally brewed in March and stored deep in the caves of Germany, this beer was brought to the masses to celebrate in October. It is a Vienna-style lager with a bit more malt and hops making a malty but balanced beverage. Copper-orange in color, it sports a toasty malt backbone that wonderfully compliments itself with many of our menu items.

Marzen Style Lager

breweries.name: Manayunk Brewery and Restaurant
breweries.description:
During the 1800's and into the 20th century, Manayunk was known for the manufacture and sales of fine textiles. Krook's Mill, now the Manayunk Brewery and Restaurant, was one of the linchpins of the then booming industry. Anne Dawson opened the mill in 1822 at the mouth of the Manayunk Canal and the Krook family followed with the existing building just short of 100 years later in 1912. A cornerstone from the original mill was placed in the new building. Krook's Mill eventually closed its doors in 1992.

Four years later, Harry Renner IV brought the facility back to life as a space for retail business, a fine eatery, a brewery and as an entertainment complex for both neighbors and visitors alike to enjoy. Our first batch of fresh-brewed beer was tapped on October 17, 1996. In 2000, we expanded our outdoor seating with a deck overlooking the Schuylkill River. In 2003, we added a Stone Pizza Oven and a Sushi Bar to expand our menu selection. Today you can still find the scale, now an antique, that was once used to weigh the wool brought into the factory.

data.name: Maple City Gold
data.description: No, there is no maple flavor here, just a great beer with a good name.  LaPorte, Indiana is known as the "Maple City" because of its trees.  This German style Oktoberfest lager beer has a golden copper color and intense malty flavor.  We make this beer 4 times a year, but it is hard to find because it goes so fast.  Give it a try and you may find it worthy of the gold.... or at least another round.

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

breweries.name: Buckeye Brewing Company
breweries.description: Buckeye Brewing began brewing in 1997. The flagship beer, Hippie IPA, was first bottled in 1998. We are one of only three breweries bottling in Cleveland, OH. While well known for hoppy Pale and IPA, other styles shine as well. Buckeye produces everything from German-style Kolsch to Belgian-style Saison. Buckeye’s bottled products can be found in quality bottle shops across Ohio. Buckeye currently brews on a 15 barrel Century brew house. Stay tuned for updates on our front page.

breweries.name: Oskar Blues Brewery
breweries.description: Oskar Blues Brewery is part of the Oskar Blues Grill and Brew restaurant and was located in Lyons, Colorado, near the city of Boulder. The brewery is now in Longmont, CO - a much larger town just east of Lyons. Oskar Blues is unique in that it serves craft-brewed beer in cans, contrary to the normal practice of bottling micro brews. The brewery is owned by Dale Katechis, a native of Florence, Alabama who brought canned beer and southern fried foods together for an interesting twist on the micro-brew pub.

data.name: Marvin the Marzen
data.description: This Lager might seem a little alien to those expecting an ale but never fear, Marzen (or Oktoberfest), is characterized by a malty aroma and not very hoppy at all. Yeah, Marvin is a little full of himself, but maybe he should be – after all, he is very filling and his hubris is kinda cute. Similar to a red Vienna Lager, but a little less robust.

breweries.name: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Moccasin Bend Brewing Company is located in the historic St. Elmo district of Chattanooga, TN.  We’re at the foot of Lookout Mountain just steps away from the world-famous Incline Railway and very near to the great Moccasin Bend of the Tennessee River. 

MBBC was started by two brewers whose quest for the perfect beer led them to learn the art of brewing.  Chris Hunt and Duncan Guy began their brewing education in the Barley Mob Brewers homebrewing club and continued to search for unique and distinctive ale and lager formulas. They decided to offer their creations to the public through a small batch microbrewery in 2006.  Soon thereafter, award-winning brewer Courtney Tyvand joined the two and presented his smoked porter at the brewery’s first beer dinner in October of 2006.

The brewery is located on the ground floor of a historic building at 4015 Tennessee Avenue in St. Elmo.  The building is constructed of foot-square cedar timbers and two-foot thick walls made of granite stone and mortar.  Built in 1911 as a packaging factory for K-Rations for WWI, we occasionally find artifacts from that era in the building walls and ceiling.  The brewery shares space with the Chattanooga U-Brew, a brew-on-premises business owned by Greg McCort. 

MBBC is proud to offer small batch specialty ales and lagers in kegs of various sizes.  A tasting room is part of the brewery; samples of our beers can be tasted and tested on premises.  Occasionally we have tasting events or tapping events at the brewery or at a nearby bar or restaurant.  Please check our calendar for scheduled tasting events at the brewery.

breweries.name: Crow Peak Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Crow Peak Brewing Company began on March 9, 2007. The brewery is located in Spearfish, South Dakota at the foot of the beautiful Black Hills.

We began in a small tap room with a 5 barrel system. Word got out about Crow Peaks great beers starting a dedicated fan base. With the popularity of the beer growing, so did the brewery.

In December of 2009 we opened the doors to our new building and 30 barrel brewhouse.

Crow Peak beers can be found on tap and in cans throughout South Dakota, North Dakota, Omaha, NE, and Eastern Wyoming. We are proud to distribute  11th Hour IPA,  Pile of Dirt Porter and Canyon Cream Ale, as well as a number of seasonal offerings.

style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: EJ Phair Brewing Company and Alehouse
breweries.nameShortDisplay: EJ Phair Brewing Company and Alehouse

data.name: Märzen
data.description:
In former times the Brauordnung ("brewing ordinance") decreed, that brewing was allowed only from Michaelmas (29. September) to George (23. April). To bridge the resulting gap, brewers made a special beer, which was longer durable: The Märzen.
Some more hop and stronger boiling of the brew helped to cover the summer times. And we do the same now.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: A German style amber Lager also known as Oktoberfest. Deep orange in color with a medium body. Smooth, clean, rather rich and slightly toast, with a depth of malt character. Brewed with 2-Row Malt, Pilsner Malt, Vienna Malt and Dark Munich Malt. Hopped with Tettnang and Hallertau hops and German lager yeast. Marzen is a Seasonal and contains 4.9% ABV.

breweries.name: Kirkwood Station Brewing Company
breweries.description: Kirkwood Station Restaurant and Brewing Co. is located just a block north of the historic train station in beautiful downtown Kirkwood Missouri, a southwest suburb of St. Louis. Established in 2009, we are building a tradition of taste, quality, service and charm. With our award winning craft beer, exceptional food, and fabulous live music, the focus is on our guests and great times! Sit back with friends and enjoy the wonderful food and craft beer as you play billiards, throw darts, watch the game, or dance the night away. Whether it’s a small gathering or a party of 275 guests, Kirkwood Station wants you to enjoy the ride.

data.name: Marzën
data.description: German Spring Lager aged to perfection brewed with 2 Row Barley, Crystal, Victory and Munich Malts. Has an amber complexion with caramel and roasted characteristics and a fairly dry finish. This higher gravity lager is named after the month of March when most brewers made this beer.

breweries.name: Big E Ales
breweries.description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

Upper Austria's largest private brewery is located in the picturesque Salzkammergut region, generated where only the best domestic raw materials, the famous beer. The revitalized modern vaulted rooms of the castle of Westraktes Eggenberg are available for events.

data.name: Märzen
data.description: Märzen (Mayrt-zen) was historically brewed in Bavaria from March through the end of October. It was brewed dark and strong, using dark roasted Munich and caramelized Munich malt to help cover up flavor changes from the lack of refrigeration (ice in those days) used to keep the beers cold in the cellars during the warm summer months. It was also the beer served at the Original Oktoberfest celebration, which originated as a wedding reception for the King Ludwig I and Maria Theresa. Bavaria was a very poor country and had little cause for celebration, so the King and Queen invited the entire population of Bavaria to the reception. They showed up that year and every year thereafter, and the event evolved into the modern day Oktoberfest. Gordon Biersch Märzen accentuates the flavors of the dark roasted imported malted barley and exhibits a caramel malt aftertaste, while downplaying the hop level.

breweries.name: Gordon Biersch Brewing
breweries.description: In 1997, Gordon Biersch opened a state-of-the-art brewery and bottling facility in San Jose, CA in order to begin bottling and distributing its famed, German-style beers. Today, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company is a brewing industry leader with 22 years of experience and counting. The microbrew trend continues to grow, and the company is actively expanding its distribution nationwide. Since 1998, Gordon Biersch Brewing Company has more than doubled its production, increasing its capacity to 3.1 million gallons of beer annually, making Gordon Biersch Brewing Company the largest brewery in the San Francisco Bay Area.

data.name: Marzen
data.description: A smooth, amber lager comparable to an Oktoberfest, malty with a delicate hop aroma and balanced bitterness from Perle, Hallertau and Tettnang varieties.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.

data.name: Marzen - Oktoberfest
data.description: Marzen is a lager, orange/reddish in color, the style is characteried by a medium to full body, malty flavor and clean dry finish. Typically served in a Maß. 5.6 ABV (alcohol by volume) 22 IBU (international bittering units)

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. breweries.name: Prost Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Brewery was made by the Ziemann GmbH in 1963. It was installed at the Bucher Bräu in the German city of Grafenau and used there until 1984. In 1984 it was overhauled and sold to Brauerei Hümmer of Breitengüßbach, Germany, a village in the Franconian region of Bavaria.

Brauerei Hümmer started brewing beer in the Franconian village of Breitengüßbach in 1642. The brewery served the town for over 350 years until the spring of 2011. It made several styles including Altfränkisches Dunkel Bier, a rare specialty beer that we will revive in Denver.

breweries.name: Von Jakob Brewery
breweries.description:
As Von Jakob Vineyard, we have brought exceptional wines to the Southern Illinois area and beyond for over 15 years. Now, we are excited to introduce Von Jakob Brewery, complete with hand-crafted brews, made exclusively at our Orchard location in Alto Pass, Illinois.

Offering eight styles of beer ranging from our crisp, clean, lightly-hopped American Pilsner to our rich, dark Stout, you are sure to find a beer that delights your palate. Or, if you are having trouble choosing just one, we offer a flight of all eight delicious beers. We also have a great selection of domestic beers as well as premium beers from around the world for your enjoyment.

And for our wine enthusiasts out there, do not worry – our winery isn’t going anywhere. We just thought we would offer you a different libation of choice, should you want to explore it.

We sincerely thank you for your support over the years, and we welcome you to come and experience this next adventure with us!

breweries.name: Lumina Brewing Company
breweries.description: Lumina Brewing Company is dedicated to producing beer in small batches. We brew our beer right on premises. All of our beer is fresh with no preservatives. We specialize in brewing German and Bohemian Style Beer. We brew our European Style beer in accordance with the Bavarian Brewing Tradition of “Reinheitsgebot”, the German beer purity law of 1516. This means that nothing is added to the beer except yeast, hops, water and grain. All of our Bavarian Style Beer contains malt and hops from Germany. Our Brew masters have extensively traveled Germany and the Czech Republic and have visited many breweries to learn the art of old world style brewing.

That's why head brewer Jeff "Puff" Irvin and brewer "Big John" Rundall blend traditional brewing practices and modern techniques to craft fresh, full-flavored beers. Taste the true deliciosity at bars, restaurant, and retail stores across Iowa or at the Ames brewery and restaurant.

breweries.name: Church Street Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Church Street Brewing Company is bringing lagers and ales from around the world to Chicagoland. Using the finest malted barley and hops from North America, the UK, and Germany, there's something for every beer lover. Using traditional German brewing methods, Church Street will break new ground with beer-lovers by making an expansive range of both new and old beers and ales, pleasing all palates!

While we currently have several year-round beers, our tap rotation will continue to evolve, with special releases and seasonal brews. We love hearing from customers, so let us know what your favorite styles are — we might just try a batch!

data.name: Marzen Madness
data.description: Marzen means “March” in German. This was the traditional time to begin brewing beer for Oktoberfest in Germany. Our Marzen is a traditional marzen style beer made with Munich malt and three kinds of hops. We suspect this may be one of the best beers you’ll ever drink. Just pure spring water, hops, malt and our special yeast makes this a finely crafted and high quality brew. The Marzen Madness was rated #1 Oktoberfest in the world as reported by Foxnews.com.

breweries.name: McKenzie Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All of our beers are brewed in very small batches so they are always fresh and at their peak. Our brewers consistently bring home awards from the Great American Beer Festival, 24 medals so far. Our award-winning beers are brewed at all three locations, where our brewers strive to push the creative envelope.  Our beer selection is both consistent, with four flagship brands, and fresh with new offerings of seasonal and dark beers.

Unfortunately we can not go under the Steelhead name due to Trademark issues so we will be McKenzie Brewing Company.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Open daily at 11:30am

data.name: Märzen/Oktoberfest
data.description: A medium bodied lager with a toasted malty flavor.  Märzen style beers have a clean mild hop bitterness and no hop aroma.  Deep copper in color.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: German-Style Märzen
style.description: Märzens are characterized by a medium body and broad range of color. They can range from golden to reddish orange. Sweet maltiness should dominate slightly over a clean hop bitterness. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be low but notable. Ale-like fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Thunder Canyon Brewery
breweries.description:
Thunder Canyon Brewery, Located in the foothills Mall in Northwest Tucson opened in November of 1997.

Tucson's most award winning brewpub. Locally owned and independent.
 
Our objective is simple: We serve the finest, hand-crafted beers produced from a working, on-site brewery; we offer healthy, contemporary bistro-style cuisine; and we serve it all up in a fun, clean and friendly environment.

data.name: Marzenbier
data.description: Marzenbier is a malt lovers beer. A lager beer, in the Oktoberfest tradition, hopped in the middle so as not to overpower the sweet malt body. An easy drinking malt liquor, copper colored.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Lexington Avenue Brewery
breweries.description: Good times await in Asheville at the Lexington Avenue Brewery. Relax a while on our open air patio. Enjoy a craft beer and an incredible meal at the 92’ curving bar or a custom built dining table. Our historic downtown Asheville building provides the perfect atmosphere. The front stage regularly entertains LAB guests during dinner hours.

data.name: Marzenbier
data.description: Deep brown with touches of amber, this traditional German/Austrian-style translates as “March beer,” historically brewed in the early Spring and stored throughout the summer months in cool mountain caves, during which time it was too difficult to brew due to the hot weather. This style is the forerunner to Oktöberfestbier. Toasty malt characteristics are balanced by notes of Noble hops, offering a mild and pleasant bitterness. Full-bodied yet crisp, it is the perfect beer to complement the shifting seasons.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Märzenbier
data.description: The Märzenbier is an Octoberfest-style amber lager brewed with Vienna, Munich, and Caramunich malts and lightly hopped with German Perle hops. The Bavarian lager yeast leaves a clean, malt focused beer perfect for drinking by the liter outside in the cool fall weather!

breweries.name: Westbrook Brewing Company
breweries.description: Westbrook Brewing is a new craft brewery in Mt. Pleasant, SC. Our mission is to make the most interesting, drinkable, and generally awesome beer possible. We love experimenting with different ingredients and brewing techniques, and we hope you’ll have as much fun drinking our beer as we do making it.

data.name: Marzenfest
data.description:
Marzenfest is Vienna Style Amber Lager that is well-aged, crisp, clean and easy to drink.

The word Marzen is German for March and this excellent brew closely resembles another great beer festival - the Oktoberfest.

So dust off the snow, put the coat away and come by so we can pour you a stein of spring at its best.

available.name: Spring
available.description: Available during the spring months.

breweries.name: Crown Brewing
breweries.description:
When the Crown Brewing Company opened its doors in 2008 we had one goal in mind, "Craft the Best Beer Period!" In 2010 our Industrial Porter won a Bronze Medal in the World Beer Cup, Brown Porter category.

We offer a selection of six to eight of our hand-crafted beers, fresh and on tap year round. In addition to our foundation beers, we brew special seasonal beers throughout the year. So, stop on in and see what's new!

data.name: Marzenfest/Oktoberfest Marzen
data.description: In Germany, these special beers were called Marzen [March] for the month in which they were brewed. When brewing resumed again in the fall, the remaining stock of Marzen was brought out for the Oktoberfest. In this way, a single style of beer came to be known by two names. 5.8% Volume
